title: 3  Present Perfect Simple
text:
Rule Connects a past action to the present; the result is what matters.
Example (song lyric) — U2 – “I Still Haven’t Found What I’m Looking For”.


I haven’t found what I’m looking for. – Present perfect marks an unfinished search whose impact is still felt now.

title: 4  Present Perfect Progressive
text:
Rule Emphasises duration of an activity that began in the past and continues now (often with for/since).
Example (song lyric + still image)

“I’ve been roaming around, always looking down at all I see…” – Snow Patrol, Chasing Cars (0:03).




Snow Patrol - “Chasing Cars”

title: 5  Past Perfect Simple
text:
Rule Describes an action that was completed before another point in the past.
Example (film quote – text)

“I had already locked the door before I realised the keys were inside.” – Mission: Impossible (1996).

title: 6  Past Perfect Progressive
text:
Rule Highlights the ongoing nature of a past action up to a second past moment.
Example (news clip – video)


“The workers had been striking for weeks when the agreement was signed.”

title: 7  Modals of Possibility and Probability
text:
Rule • Express different degrees of certainty. Must ≈ 95 %, may ≈ 50 %, might/could ≈ 30 %.
Example (weather forecast – video)


“It might rain tonight, so keep an umbrella handy.”
crumbs: 7  Modals of Possibility and Probability
